question.questionText: Andi and Scott decided to investigate solar water heaters using collectors of different colors (but the same size) as one variable and covered versus uncovered as a second variable. Look at the graph of their data and answer the questions below. Why would comparing only the red uncovered heater with the blue covered heater not provide useful information?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: When 2 variables are changed, it is impossible to determine which variable is causing what effect.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: More than one manipulated variable.
It has too many manipulated variables it could not give the same information.
I think red reflected the heat away.
Maybe because they are each different types.
Because one is covered and the other is not covered.
Because they are different colors.

Because the red uncovered get colder and the blue get hotter.
It would not be useful because red is uncovered and blue is covered and it is not fair.

Because both of them are different one is uncovered and another is covered.
